gloss: English clergyman who (with John Henry Newman and Edward Pusey) founded the Oxford movement (1792-1866) / English prelate and theologian who (with John Keble and Edward Pusey) founded the Oxford movement; Newman later turned to Roman Catholicism and became a cardinal (1801-1890) / English reformer who published attacks on George III and supported the rights of the American colonists (1727-1797) / a material made of cellulose pulp derived mainly from wood or rags or certain grasses / a single domestic animal / a soft heavy compact variety of talc having a soapy feel; used to make hearths and tabletops and ornaments / a variety of cattle produced by crossbreeding with a superior breed / a well-bred person / a wide flat board used to cover walls or partitions; made from plaster or wood pulp or other materials and used primarily to form the interior walls of houses / a young animal without a mother / adult female chicken / an animal trained for and used for heavy labor / any number of entities (members) considered as a unit / largest carnivorous land animals ever known / lesser anteater / not domesticated / solid-hoofed herbivorous quadruped domesticated since prehistoric times / the audience gathered together in a theatre or cinema

one of four subclasses or superorders of Monocotyledones; comprises about 19,000 species in 25 families of mostly terrestrial herbs especially of moist places including: Cyperaceae; Gramineae; Bromeliaceae; and Zingiberaceae
a woman who is old / an adult person who is male (as opposed to a woman) / an elderly man
